column1: L, Pork Chops, michelewln, 2021-04-29, Welcome to Street Prophets Thursday Coffee Hour. I thought I would continue with my recipe diaries. After all I have over 1200 recipes. Today I thought I’d give you some recipes for pork chops. Apricot Ginger Pork Chops Serving Size: 6     Amount Measure            Ingredient -- Preparation Method --------    ------------            -------------------------------- 6          each                 pork chops -- thick cut 3          tablespoons       apricot jam 1          teaspoon           ginger root -- minced fine 1          tablespoon        light soy sauce 1          tablespoon        seasoned salt 1          teaspoon           seasoned pepper vegetable oil  Heat oil until just shimmering.  Sprinkle salt and pepper over chops.    Add chops to pan and cook until no pink remains.  Mix jam ginger and soy sauce. Pour over chops until coated and heated through  Per Serving: 261 Calories

Sprinkle Cajun spice on both sides of pork chops.  Rub in.  Put aside and let marinate for 30 minutes.  In a small saucepan heat 1 tablespoon olive oil.  Add onion and garlic and cook until softened.  Add tomato paste molasses red wine Worcestershire sauce and Dijon mustard.  Heat until boiling. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.  Heat oven to 350°F.  Heat butter and remaining tablespoon of olive oil in frying pan.  Add pork chops and sear on both sides.  Put chops in a casserole dish and cover with the sauce.  Cover and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.  Notes:  This would also work on ribs.  Per Serving: 400 Calories

Rub on all sides of pork.  Heat a large skillet to medium-high. Melt the butter in skillet and brown chops on all sides until no longer pink inside. Remove the chops from the pan and tent with aluminum foil.  In small saucepan mix all the sauce ingredients except cornstarch. Heat to boiling.  Mix cornstarch with water to form a slurry. Add to sauce mixture and heat stirring until sauce thickens. Serve sauce over pork chops.  Per Serving: 323 Calories

Serving Size: 4     Amount Measure            Ingredient -- Preparation Method --------    ------------            -------------------------------- 1½        pounds              pork loin chops -- ¾ inch thick 2          tablespoons       olive oil 1          clove                 garlic -- minced ½         teaspoon           seasoned salt ¼         teaspoon           seasoned pepper ¼         cup                   low sodium soy sauce ¼         cup                   red wine 2          tablespoons       brown sugar packed ¼         teaspoon           crushed red pepper flakes 1          tablespoon        water 1          teaspoon           cornstarch  Mix sauce ingredients together except for water and cornstarch. Set aside.  Add oil to large skillet and heat to medium-high. Sprinkle both sides of pork chops with salt and pepper.  Cook chops until just browned on both sides and remove from pan.  Add garlic to pan and cook for 30 seconds or until fragrant.  Add sauce to pan scraping up all the browned bits. Bring to a boil.  Add chops back in and cover and cook for 30 to 35 minutes.  Remove chops from pan and tent with foil.  Mix water and cornstarch together and add to sauce. Cook until sauce thickens.  Add any juices from meat back into sauce and stir.  Serve sauce over chops.  Serving Ideas: You can serve these over buttered noodles.  Per Serving: 255 Calories

Mix panko Parmesan and Italian seasoning in second plate or shallow dish. Mix flour salt and pepper in third plate or shallow dish. Dip chops in flour mixture patting off excess. Dip pork chop in egg mixture and let excess drip off. Place pork chop in bread and cheese mixture and press to adhere. Place the pork chops on a rack as you do them.  Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add chops to skillet. Cook until golden on both sides and temperature reaches 145°F in center.  Per Serving: 633 Calories

Pork Chops in Mushroom Sauce Servings: 6 Amount Measure                  Ingredient -- Preparation Method --------    ------------                  -------------------------------- 3          pounds                    pork loin chops -- thick cut ½         teaspoon                 salt 1          teaspoon                 allspice ¼         teaspoon                 pepper 1          tablespoon              unsalted butter 1          tablespoon              olive oil 1          large                       golden Delicious apple -- diced 8          ounces                    mushroom caps -- sliced 1          small                      shallot -- minced 1          clove                       garlic -- minced 1          tablespoon              Dijon mustard 2          teaspoons               cornstarch 5          ounces                    low fat evaporated milk  Mix salt pepper and allspice together and sprinkle on both sides of the chops and rub the spices into the meat.  Heat a large frying pan and add the butter and olive oil. Add chops and brown on both sides. Remove from pan.  Add the mushrooms shallot and apple to frying pan. Cook until shallot is soft around 10 minutes.  Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add chops back to pan.  Mix Dijon mustard cornstarch and milk and heat in a small saucepan to boiling. Stir constantly until thickened. Pour over pork chops.  Cover pork chops and vegetables and simmer on low for 30 minutes.  Per Serving: 276 Calories

Stuffed Pork Chops in Teriyaki Mushroom Sauce Servings: 6  Amount Measure                  Ingredient -- Preparation Method --------    ------------                  -------------------------------- 6          medium                   pork center loin chops – 1-inch thick ¼         cup                         golden seedless raisins ¼         cup                         celery -- finely diced ¼         cup                         dried apples -- finely diced 8          ounces                    mushroom caps -- sliced ½         cup                         sherry 1          clove                       garlic -- minced fine 1          teaspoon                 fresh ginger root -- minced fine 2          tablespoons             unsalted butter -- divided 2          tablespoons             olive oil -- divided ½         cup                         low sodium beef broth ¼         cup                         low-sodium teriyaki sauce 2          tablespoons             flour ½         teaspoon                 salt ¼         teaspoon                 pepper 1          teaspoon                 five-spice powder  Finely dice enough mushrooms to make ¼ cup. Put in small bowl along with raisins celery and apples. Add sherry and let soak for 15 minutes.  Trim fat from pork chops. Make a slit through center of chop lengthwise being careful not to cut all the through to the other side.  Drain fruit stuffing reserving the rest of sherry. Put stuffing in pocket of chop. Fasten with skewer or toothpick. Keep any stuffing left over.  Mix flour salt pepper and five spice well on a plate. Dip chops in flour mixture shaking off excess. Keep rest of flour mixture.  Melt 1 tablespoon of butter along with 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large frying pan over high heat. Brown chops on all sides. Remove from pan.  Add remaining butter and oil. Reduce heat to medium. Add garlic and ginger and cook for a minute.  Add rest of mushrooms and any remaining stuffing and cook for 5 minutes stirring to keep from burning.  Add beef broth teriyaki sauce and remaining sherry to pan. Deglaze the browned bits from bottom of pan. Add pork chops. Cover and simmer on low for 30 minutes.  Remove chops from pan. Add remaining flour mixture to pan and raise heat to high. Cook stirring until gravy thickens and sauce reduces about 3 minutes. Pour over chops.  Per Serving: 387 Calories

Heat 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat and cook chops until lightly browned on both sides. Remove chops to platter and tent with foil.  Add remaining butter to pan and add shallot. Cook for a couple minutes or until softened. Add wine and milk to pan. Heat to boiling. Add mustard and mix thoroughly. Mix cornstarch and water and add to sauce. Cook and stir until thickened.  Add chops back to pan and spoon sauce over the chops. Cover and cook on low for 10 to 15 minutes or until chops reach 140°F.  Per Serving: 338 Calories
